title: What is the worst possible outcome for election night 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: The worst possible outcome is the one that most undermines voters' confidence in the election. A repeat of 2016 would be bad - a popular vote for one presidential candidate and an Electoral College win for the other, and a sweep of the House and Senate. As bad as the 2016 election was, there is a lot of room for a larger majority of popular vote and a narrower margin of victory in the ELectoral College. Donald Trump won the 2016 election by three narrow victories in Pensylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin. He could have lost any two of those and still gotten the presidency, and that would have made people even more upset than people have been for the four years of rule by the most unpopular president since Richard M. Nixon took his final presidential helicopter ride. This year, with mail-in ballots there will be an added factor - that the US Postal Service is being entrusted with postmarking ballots envelopes delivering them to elections offices. If the election is close and Donald Trump wins, that is going to be really bad, because Donald Trump put a toady in charge of the US Postal Service and that toady wants him reelected and has investments in delivery companies that would profit if he could undermine the effectiveness of the USPS. People are already rioting in the USA against government on both sides of the political spectrum. To be fair, that was already happening under the Obama administration, but it has gotten far worse under Trump's presidency. It has not helped matters that Donald Trump spent four years insulting the majority party Democrats, calling us evil and blaming us and our elected representatives for the country's problems, and claiming that the press is evil. If Donald Trump is reelected there is no reason to believe he will be less divisive during his second term when he will not be campaigning and will have far more time to golf. So the worst possible outcome will be a repeat of 2016 - Republicans take the Senate, House, and Presidency, polls show all three should have gone to the Democrats, the US Postal Service is seen as the culprit in losing ballots or failing to deliver them, and Donald Trump doubles down on claiming he has the popular support and the polls are liars and the press is evil. I will certainly be staying home that night. I hope everyone else does the same.

The worst scenario I can imagine is that in the in-person voting on 3 November 2020, Trump comes close enough to winning that he believes he will win (probably due to another Electoral College win)… before the early ballot counts are released, which show that Vice President Joe Biden won decisively. This is based on the theory that Republicans are, as a group, more likely to vote on Election Day and Democrats are more likely to vote via some method of early voting.* In my worst case scenario, Trump dog whistles to the white supremacist groups and other far right organisations, etc, for violence in cities and states with Democratic majorities. Much chaos and violence ensues, in line with the fact that the majority of politically related violence in this country is committed by right wing individuals and groups (somewhere around 90%). *There are some indications that more Republican registered voters have been taking advantage of some form of early voting than was previously predicted. Assuming that all those registered Republicans voted for Trump, this makes the above scenario less likely. I hope.

As many of you already know, Democrats will tend to vote by mail and Republicans will vote in person. This means that Trump may have a perceived lead on Election night. Trump has already called on the Proud Boys and other thugs to stand by. Trump will do everything he can to intimidate the people counting mail-in votes after Election Day. How do I know this? Let's go back to the 2000 Florida recount.  The Republithugs recruited and hired these nice folks to intimidate the vote counters in Florida. Now imagine this on a national scale only with these guys.  They may look like the Village People but they are a lot nastier. Trump has been undermining faith in our election since 2016. He will go to court to challenge the legitimacy of the mail-in ballots. This could drag on for months. There's a reason why Republicans are in such a hurry to put Amy Coney Barrett on the Supreme Court. Trump thinks his judges belong to him. Everybody who remembers the 5–4 Bush v. Gore Supreme Court decision should be chilled. Justice Scalia told us to get over it. Guess who was one of his clerks.

The worst outcome for the election would be a deliberate democrat attempt to keep the outcome from being official until sometime in January after the official presidency transition date. This might allow Nancy Pelosi to at least temporarily become the president of the United States until the issue is resolved. If she decides to act on the power this position would give her she might have enough time to implement parts of the democrat agenda even though she was not elected to be president of the U.S. The video below describes scenarios under which Nancy Pelosi can become the U.S. President (Judge Napolitano explains if Pelosi could become acting president if election results are delayed past Jan. 20).

The presidential election is still based on the electoral college - the candidate winning the popular election in each state is allotted that states electors - 538 in total. An absolute majority of 270 is required to win. If a majority cannot be awarded to a candidate, the House of Representatives performs a presidential election session - one vote for each state. The worst scenario I can imagine is that there is not a majority of electors and the House has to have the presidential vote - which has been done twice (1801 and 1825). With things as divisive as they have been and concerns of voter fraud, to then have to rely on a process that has been used twice in the history of the country will be difficult for many US citizens to live with.

Joe Biden wins, in a squeaker, but, enough that anyone but Trump would concede. Then Trump files suit to try to prevent the provisional ballots from being counted or even the mail-in ballots from being counted. And it works its’ way up to the Supreme Court with Amy Bony Carrot installed. Then we wind up with another 4 years of bigotry, hatred, and lawlessness.

That tRump will win. I'll be livid, pissed off, unhappy because lt’ll mean 4 more years of idiocy, lies, his followers brainwashed by him, the orangutan, threats of changing the ACA, firing those he doesn't like or he thinks are a threat to him. Social Security threats, calling elected officials names like Pochontis, Sleepy Joe, still calling Hillary Clinton Crooked Hillary, the list goes on and on. If he's reelected I fear for our Country.

I think the worst possible outcome for America would be an one that is not a clear, and decisive victory. Whether the winner is Democrat, or Republican a contested election that drags on with months of drama, and litigation would prove be even more divisive than the present contest.

Trump wins a decisive electoral victory Election night, but then ballots keep on being counted for days. One by one, states flip from Trump to Biden after truckloads of ballots are ‘discovered,’ like the way Al Franken ‘won’ his seat in the Senate. No one will be satisfied on either side, and passion will run high, because each side sees disaster if the other side prevails.
Joe biden wins. The senate is taken over by democrats.
A narrow Biden win. Trump will kick off- rouse his base to violence & riots. An (even greater) cascade of lies and hate.

Trump loses the popular vote, the electoral college goes undecided/contested, and Trump is handed the election by the Supreme Court or state legislatures against the will of the people. The prevention? A landslide.
There won’t be any outcome on election night, since the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court sided with those who want mail-in votes to count until some days and nights after election night.
Trump is declared the winner and Democrats find I million mail in ballots in the back of electric postal trucks.
Full blown nation wide riots between the 2 sides. This mess won't end well for anybody but no matter who wins I don't think worst case will happen. I am sure the losers will cause trouble.
Media “projections” declare a winner and get it wrong. Loony Left riots, already in progress, will grow and multiply. Biden will be stuck with them.
The worst thing that could happen is Biden is elected. The America we love would be over. Socialism will come in and change our nation forever.
